[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Cooking Recipe and Inventory Management System (CRIMS) defines requirements for recipe management, ingredient tracking, and inventory updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CRIMS supports recipe storage, ingredient monitoring, stock updates, and user-defined dietary preferences.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CRIMS integrates with ingredient databases, barcode scanners, and nutrition APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CRIMS provides web and mobile interfaces for recipe management and inventory tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CRIMS supports barcode scanners, weighing scales, and touchscreens.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CRIMS uses PostgreSQL for structured storage  REST APIs for recipe management  stock updates  data retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CRIMS secures transactions via TLS encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CRIMS optimizes storage for large recipe libraries and real-time stock updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CRIMS tracks ingredient usage  updates stock levels  provides notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CRIMS is configurable for home and commercial kitchen settings.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CRIMS connects with nutrition analysis  grocery ordering  inventory management apps.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CRIMS manages recipe storage  ingredient tracking  inventory updates  dietary compatibility analysis.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CRIMS is designed for home cooks  chefs  restaurant managers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CRIMS requires internet access for cloud inventory tracking and shared recipes.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CRIMS relies on barcode scanning  nutrition data  external ingredient databases.

[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations.CRIMS: Cooking Recipe and Inventory Management System

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall import recipes from external sources.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide an API for grocery shopping and inventory apps.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall manage recipes with details including name  description  preparation time  cooking time  servings  calories per serving  difficulty level (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall track ingredients with attributes such as name  type  calories per 100g  associated recipes (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall manage ingredient stocks  including packaging variations  storage locations  ingredient usage tracking  ensuring real-time inventory updates (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a dashboard for managing recipes and inventory.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update ingredient stock levels in 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store recipe details  ingredients  preparation steps.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store ingredient stock levels  packaging details  expiration dates.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support real-time stock updates and tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with food safety regulations and inventory management standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log inventory updates  ingredient tracking  recipe modifications for auditing.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests recipe storage, inventory tracking, stock updates, reporting accuracy, and system performance.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and inventory tracking manuals.
[SEC] 5. References: Food regulations, nutrition databases, and inventory management standards.
